thread.title: OFFICIAL: Middlesbrough sign Guedioura from Watford
thread.title_full: OFFICIAL: Middlesbrough sign Guedioura from Watford

title: OFFICIAL: Middlesbrough sign Guedioura from Watford
text:
0 31 Jan 2017 23:05:34 Aitor Karanka's side have made a late addition to the squad on deadline day bringing experienced Algeria international to the Riverside 
Middlesbrough have completed the signing of Adlene Guedioura from Watford on a two-and-a-half year deal, the club have announced. CONFIRMED | #Boro have completed the signing of Adlene Guedioura from @WatfordFC ! #UTB — Middlesbrough FC (@Boro) January 31, 2017 
Guedioura, 31, is an Algeria international and arrives at the Riverside with a wealth of experience, having also amassed over 170 appearances since arriving in England in 2010. 
Keep up to date with all the Deadline Day rumours! 
The midfielder had previously been linked with a move to Hull City, but the Tigers were forced out of the picture by Boro, who forced the deal over the line shortly before the deadline on Tuesday. 
Reports claim Guedioura arrives for a fee of around £3.5 million plus add-ons, though the club's official statement refused to reveal details. 
Should the midfielder slot straight into the first team at Boro, he could make his debut against Tottenham at White Hart Lane on Saturday. Related
